@graph.name: Vegan French Toast | Indian Spiced Masala Toast - Ministry of Curry
@graph.description: Here is a 20-minute Indian spiced vegan french toast recipe with gram flour, onion, chilies, ginger, garlic, and turmeric.

itemListElement.name: Vegan French Toast | Savory Masala Toast Recipe

@graph.headline: Vegan French Toast | Savory Masala Toast Recipe

@graph.name: Archana
@graph.description: Hey there! I am a techie turned recipe developer, cooking instructor, and food blogger. I love food and enjoy developing easy and healthy recipes for busy lifestyles. I live in New Jersey with my husband and two sons.

@graph.name: Vegan French Toast
@graph.description: Made with gram flour, onions & warming spices like turmeric & chili, these 10 min savory french toast are a must-try for a quick meal.
recipeIngredient: 2  bread slices (hearty white or other firm bread **)

recipeInstructions.text: Add besan to a wide mixing bowl. Break any lumps. Add half of the water and mix well to form a smooth paste and then add the remaining water to make a flowy batter. Add salt, turmeric, green chili, ginger and garlic paste, onions, and cilantro. Mix well. Optimally stir in red chili flakes for extra spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Add besan to a wide mixing bowl. Break any lumps. Add half of the water and mix well to form a smooth paste and then add the remaining water to make a flowy batter. Add salt, turmeric, green chili, ginger and garlic paste, onions, and cilantro. Mix well. Optimally stir in red chili flakes for extra spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip one sliced bread in the batter and press down with a spoon so the bread soaks the batter. Turn the bread over gently, press down and spoon over some batter on the top side.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip one sliced bread in the batter and press down with a spoon so the bread soaks the batter. Turn the bread over gently, press down and spoon over some batter on the top side.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a non-stick skillet at medium heat and spread 1 teaspoon of oil. Place the soaked bread slice on the skillet and spread over 1 to 2 spoonfuls of batter on top. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until the bottom side is golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a non-stick skillet at medium heat and spread 1 teaspoon of oil. Place the soaked bread slice on the skillet and spread over 1 to 2 spoonfuls of batter on top. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until the bottom side is golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully flip over the bread and cook on the other side for 3 to 4 minutes. Add a teaspoon of oil to the sides of the bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully flip over the bread and cook on the other side for 3 to 4 minutes. Add a teaspoon of oil to the sides of the bread.

recipeInstructions.text: Repeat steps 2 to 4 for the second slice of bread. Enjoy hot with ketchup, green chutney or sriracha sauce, and ginger chai.
recipeInstructions.name: Repeat steps 2 to 4 for the second slice of bread. Enjoy hot with ketchup, green chutney or sriracha sauce, and ginger chai.
